attributes.title: Urban Vegetable Garden
attributes.description:
Created on May 16, 2011 by ensphoto on Sourcemap.org:

This sourcemap serves to visually illustrate how a vegetable garden became established on an empty lot in Brooklyn and explore it's effect on the carbon footprint of our diets.

attributes.name: Urban Vegetable Garden
attributes.1: Kent Ave & S 3rd St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
attributes.address: Kent Ave & S 3rd St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
attributes.title: Urban Vegetable Garden
attributes.description: This sourcemap serves to visually illustrate how a vegetable garden became established on an empty lot in Brooklyn and explore it's effect on the carbon footprint of our diets.

attributes.name: Imported Organic Soil
attributes.title: Imported Organic Soil
attributes.description: We acquired soil from a team member's composted manure pile at her farm outside of Gardner, NY.

attributes.name: Fedco Seeds
attributes.title: Fedco Seeds
attributes.description: We ordered our seed from a small-scale, organic seed operation.

attributes.name: Garden Supplies
attributes.1: 1st Ave & E 7th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
attributes.address: 1st Ave & E 7th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
attributes.title: Garden Supplies
attributes.description:
We bought our garden supplies from Saifee Garden Store. Supplies include: 
Two shovels
Three hardhats
100 dehydrated soil disks
Two planting trays
One growing light
One wire cutter
One pH meter

attributes.name: Straw
attributes.title: Straw
attributes.description: We used straw to buffer the native (toxic) soil from the organic imported soil. We retrieved the straw from a farmer in Upstate New York.

attributes.name: Water
attributes.1: Wythe Ave & S 4th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
attributes.address: Wythe Ave & S 4th St, Brooklyn, NY 11211, USA
attributes.title: Water
attributes.description: We were given access to a faucet by a local mechanic who's shop was only a few feet away. We filled buckets when we had to water the garden but mostly the rain worked as our chief water supplier.

attributes.name: Exported Crops (Theoretical Data)
attributes.1: 520 E 5th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
attributes.address: 520 E 5th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
attributes.title: Exported Crops (Theoretical Data)
attributes.description: This line represents the total distance our crops would have to travel before we could consume them. Traveling by bicycle, it would be a short distance of less than two miles. Compare that with a broccoli purchased from Key Foods. (Part 7)

attributes.name: Common Source of Frozen Broccoli (Compare to Part 6)
attributes.title: Common Source of Frozen Broccoli (Compare to Part 6)
attributes.description: China has been a long time producer of Broccoli, especially frozen vegetables. Compare this distance to that illustrated in Part 6.
